To choose the Deer Creek Hockey League's most valuable goalie, the coaches looked at the save percentages of the goalies for all 8 teams. The highest save percentage is 0.830 and the lowest is 0.675. The mean save percentage is 0.768, and the mean absolute deviation is about 0.055.
Which is a measure of how much the save percentages typically vary?

Members of the Valley View Soccer League sold raffle tickets to help pay for new goalposts and nets. On one team, all 18 players sold at least 5 tickets, and some sold more than 25 tickets. The median number of tickets sold by this team was 12.5 tickets, and the interquartile range was 15 tickets.
Which is a measure of how much the number of tickets sold by this team varied?
For a set of data 2,3,9,8,6, what is the number of digits?

Carlos and 5 of his friends just finished playing a racing video game against each other. The median score was 2,600 points, and the interquartile range was 750 points. All the players scored at least 2,000 points, and Carlos scored 3,100 points.
What is a typical score for these players?

Women from 10 different countries have won the annual Greentree Marathon, a 26.2-mile race. For the marathon's 13-year history, the median women's winning time is about 146 minutes, or 2 hours 26 minutes, and the interquartile range is about 7 minutes.
Which best describes a typical time for a woman winning the Greentree Marathon?

The Anderson family is playing a word game. Players score points for using their letter tiles to spell words, with long words and words with uncommon letters scoring more points. Each of the 5 players has had 3 turns so far. The players' mean score per turn is 14.4 points, and the mean absolute deviation is 8 points. Melissa, who is only 12 years old, has scored the most points.
Which is a measure of how much the players' scores per turn have typically varied?

The girl's soccer team signed up for a 5-kilometer charity run. They ran a practice 5K this afternoon, and their coach recorded their times. All 23 of the girls finished in less than 35 minutes, with 21 minutes being the fastest time. The mean time was about 26.5 minutes, and the mean absolute deviation was about 2.8 minutes.
About how long did it typically take a member of the soccer team to run 1 kilometers?

The Bradyville Bears have played 9 basketball games so far this year and won 4 of them. They have scored at least 25 points in each game. The mean number of points scored per game is 37.6, and the mean absolute deviation is about 7.6 points.
Which is a measure of how much the team's scores typically vary?

Marvin is waiting tables at a local restaurant a few nights a week. He records the total amount of tips he receives each time he works. Last month, Marvin worked 10 shifts and earned at least $35.50 in tips each night. On two nights, he earned over $65. The mean of the tips he earned each shift was $53.75, and the mean absolute deviation was $11.25.
Which best describes the typical amount Marvin earned in tips for a shift?

One of the events at the annual Glacier City Hockey All-Star Competition is a contest to see which player has the fastest slap shot. Recent winners have all had slap shots over 100 miles per hour, with some approaching 110 miles per hour. Over the past 10 years, the median winning slap shot speed is about 105.7 miles per hour, and the interquartile range is 5.3 miles per hour.
Which is a typical speed of a winning slap shot in this competition?

Wesley's dog, Lila, just had 6 puppies. The heaviest puppy weighed 1.3 pounds, and the lightest puppy weighed 0.8 pounds. The mean of the puppies' weights was 1.1 pounds, and the mean absolute deviation was 0.13 pounds.
Which best describes a typical weight of these newborn puppies?

Mr. Parker assigned an oral presentation about an animal to each of the students in his homeroom. Of the 21 students in class, 5 students gave a presentation that was less than 2 minutes, while 3 students gave presentations longer than 4 minutes. The median length of the presentations was 2.5 minutes, and the interquartile range was about 1.9 minutes.
Which is a typical length of a student's presentation?
If the mean of a set of 1,7,8, a, 4 is 5, the median is m, and the range is n, what is m+n?

Carly's Crackers surveyed customers to find out who was eating their crackers. Though they found that snackers between the ages of 2 and 89 loved the crackers, the majority of the cracker snackers were between the ages of 5 and 30. The median snacker age was 15 years old, and the interquartile range was 28.5 years.
Which is a typical age of a surveyed snacker who enjoyed Carly's Crackers?

Elm Lawn Middle School organizes its annual canned-food drive as a contest. They compete to see which of the 18 homerooms collects the most cans of food. This year, each homeroom collected at least 60 cans, with some collecting over 100. The median number of cans collected was 86.5, and the interquartile range was 23 cans.
Which is a typical number of cans a homeroom collected this year?
